channel.title: Europa Universalis 3
channel.description:
Imagine a game that combines RISK with Civilization and adds over 9000 micromanagement options.
[ul][li]Players can decide their own form of government, the structure of their society, trade policies, etc.[/li] [li]Players can take up 'national ideas' to steer their nations in different directions.[/li] [li]People such as Sir Isaac Newton, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, or René Descartes are available to the player as advisors (as generic advisors, they have no unique abilities).[/li] [li]A topographic map in full 3D allows for a complete world view and contains more than 1,700 provinces and sea zones.[/li] [li]Players can choose between any of the 250+ nations that existed during the time period anywhere in the world, such as Scotland, Kazan, Bohemia, and Bali.[/li] [li]4,000 different monarchs as well as 1,000 other individuals appear in the game.[/li] [li]More than 100 different unit troops are available in the game.[/li] [li]Co-operative multiplayer mode to allow several players to work together to control a single nation.[/li][/ul]
NOW COME AND JOINS US AT IRC.ESPER.NET #RTS FOR AWESOMESAUCE MP GAMES!!!
[img]http://www.videogamesblogger.com/wp-content/uploads/2006/10/europa-universalis-3-pc-screenshot.jpg[/img]
[img]http://ladympire.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2008/06/abu.jpg[/img]
[img]http://files.myopera.com/Zotlan/albums/151436/Europa%20Universalis%203%201280x960%203.jpg[/img]

item.title: Europa Universalis 3
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Meh I downloaded Victoria: Revolutions, and I much prefer it. It’s basically the same thing but tightened up, I played as belgium, took the netherlands and all they had left was some shitty Asian islands. Too bad everyone in Europe hates me because I rejected 5 peace offers until they gave me what I wanted.

Read full topic

item.title: Europa Universalis 3
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:22, topic:345337”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=441714.msg3250488#msg3250488 date=1277711477]

Try Portugal, you only piss the French, Spanish and Moroccans off instead.

I’m playing as Holland now. 2 Provinces, a crapload of income from trade and the ability to piss off Burgundy without getting pissed in the face. Peace offers suck though, in all haste I accepted a peace offer from an enemy I had never met in battle, and had to pay 250 ducats.
[/quote]

Yeah that sucks but if you just leave your armies sieging their provinces long enough they start to offer things like provinces for you to leave them alone. :)[/quote]

I got elected to Emperor of the HRE. It’s a free card to annihilate every 1 province German state out there. Revolts are getting annoying now.

Read full topic

Yeah that sucks but if you just leave your armies sieging their provinces long enough they start to offer things like provinces for you to leave them alone.

item.title: Europa Universalis 3
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:19, topic:345337”][quote author=Niall link=topic=441714.msg3248379#msg3248379 date=1277556798]

Am I downloading the right iso? ~300 mb for a game released in 2007 doesn’t sound much.

Sounds about right, we play the in nomine expansion just fyi.

Also, the tutorials don’t quite explain much, just give a few practice runs a try and/or download the manual.
[/quote]

The patch fixed the first tutorial, it also speeds up the loading time.

It’s quite a nice game. But it’s quite slow sometimes. And when I play France for instance, I can’t really attack any mid-size neighbors without pissing of the English.[/quote]

Try Portugal, you only piss the French, Spanish and Moroccans off instead.

Read full topic

item.title: Europa Universalis 3
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Radeon:

Is the AI in this game shit for single player?

It’s surprisingly good, some nations will gladly ally with you despite low relations and other nations won’t hesitate to fuck you over despite very high relations. I’ve also found the ai will do different things each game even if you do the same thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Europa Universalis 3
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:8, topic:345337”]Well I’ve just finished downloading, I shall play and then we shall see mr Speljohan.

EDIT:

I found I just couldn’t commit to one nation, I went for smaller nations like cyprus and connacht but they were just boring. Then I went for Russia and there are just too many things to keep your eye on. I disliked the lack of control and clarity over research/production and I hated how slow the pace was in terms of how little happens as months pass.[/quote]It’s about as fucking clear as it can get, but it involves quite a bit of micromanagement.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee

Well I’ve just finished downloading, I shall play and then we shall see mr Speljohan.

EDIT:

I found I just couldn’t commit to one nation, I went for smaller nations like cyprus and connacht but they were just boring. Then I went for Russia and there are just too many things to keep your eye on. I disliked the lack of control and clarity over research/production and I hated how slow the pace was in terms of how little happens as months pass.

item.title: Europa Universalis 3
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:6, topic:345337”]Were graphics sacrificed for high detail gameplay? Or is it just generally shit?[/quote]It is probably the deepest strategy game there is. Graphics are alright, screenshots just fucked it up a bit.

[quote=“c|p, post:5, topic:345337”]Imagine a Swede that doesn’t find a new strategy game to play every month and hype it up and then stop playing a week into it.[/quote]Sry but i still play every single game i’ve played in the past, but unlike u narrow-minded faggots i play more than 1 game at a time

Read full topic
